title: Cowboys' Parsons reports amid unsettled deal
content: Micah Parsons reported to training camp in Oxnard, California, on Monday, but what's not clear is whether Parsons will take part in practice when the Cowboys begin workouts Tuesday as he awaits a long-term extension.

title: IndiGo flight with 140 passengers on board makes emergency landing at Indore airport
content: An IndiGo spokesperson stated that flight 6E 813 operating from Goa International Airport (Dabolim) to Indore reported a technical snag just before landing

content: The BJP legislator also reiterated the party‚Äôs demand for a special intensive revision of West Bengal‚Äôs electoral roll, along the lines of the exercise in Bihar, to ‚Äòweed out foreign infiltrators‚Äô

title: Supreme Court verdict is a resounding slap on the face of Centre‚Äôs vendetta politics, says Karnataka Chief Minister
content: Unable to defeat me politically, the BJP and its allies stooped to misusing constitutional agencies like the CBI and ED to fabricate baseless cases against my wife and harass my family, says Chief Minister Siddaramaiah

title: Significant increase expected in voter numbers once revision of electoral rolls is over: State Election Commission
content: Rolls contain 2,66,78,256 voters, which is 9.8 lakh fewer voters than in the rolls used for the 2020 local body elections. SEC says higher number in 2020 list is due to active enrolment drives in the run-up to an election. In the lean periods between two elections, the focus of electoral roll revisions is more on cleaning up the lists

title: US Court Challenges Trump Administration On Harvard Funding Cuts
content: A federal judge on Monday challenged the Trump administration's reasons for slashing billions of dollars in federal funding to Harvard University, triggering a furious response from the president.

title: Ahead Of New Talks, Iran Blames Europeans For Nuclear Deal Collapse
content: Tehran blamed European powers on Monday for the failure of a landmark 2015 nuclear deal, accusing them of breaking commitments ahead of renewed talks in Istanbul with Britain, France and Germany.

title: IMF's Gita Gopinath To Step Down In August, Return to Harvard University
content: Gita Gopinath, the No. 2 official at the International Monetary Fund, will leave her post at the end of August to return to Harvard University, the IMF said in a statement on Monday.

title: Have To Remove Fake Voters: Poll Body To Top Court On Bihar Roll Revision
content: The Election Commission has denied the allegations of tweaking with the voter list in Bihar that multiple opposition parties have claimed in court.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar Resigns As Vice President, Says Will "Prioritise Health"
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar has resigned his post citing "medical advice". In a letter to President Droupadi Murmu, he said his resignation will be effective immediately.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar's Eventful Day In Parliament Before He Resigned As Vice President
content: In a sudden move, Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post on Monday evening to "prioritise health". He has sent his letter to President Droupadi Murmu, saying he is stepping down with immediate effect.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar Resigns: Outspoken Vice President Who Took On Judiciary
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar, who bowed out of office of India's 14th Vice President today two years ahead of schedule citing his health, had made his mark both in Rajya Sabha as well as in Bengal as the Governor of the state.

title: "Did Not Feel Nice, Had Very Good Ties": Kapil Sibal On Jagdeep Dhankhar's Resignation
content: Soon after Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned as the vice president, Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal on Monday hailed him as a patriot and said since he had cited health reasons for his decision, it should be accepted and one should move forward.

title: A Look At Jagdeep Dhankhar's Rajya Sabha Remarks Hours Before Resignation
content: Hours before posting his resignation on X, these are some of the remarks Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar made in the House on Monday

title: "Attempt Was Made To Defame Kanwar Yatra": Uttarakhand Chief Minister
content: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Monday that initially, there was an attempt made to "defame" the Kanwar Yatra, the pilgrimage which commenced on July 10.

title: Windless Weather Traps Volcanic Cloud Over Iceland, Triggers Pollution Red Alert
content: Iceland experts on Monday blamed a lack of wind for a volcanic cloud that has lingered over much of the island since an eruption last week.

title: Fear Of US Federal Agents Force Texas Immigrants To Stay Indoors Even During Medical Crisis
content: The 41-year-old mother, who crossed into the United States from Mexico more than two decades ago and married an American carpenter, fears federal agents may be on the hunt for her.

title: Weddings At Qutub? Delhi Eyes Heritage Monuments To Boost Event Tourism
content: In a move that could redefine Delhi's cultural landscape, the city's iconic monuments may soon double up as venues for destination weddings, concerts, and global events.

title: Maharashtra To Challenge Order On 2006 Mumbai Blasts In Supreme Court
content: Expressing shock over Bombay High Court's decision to acquit 12 accused of 2006 Mumbai blasts, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Monday announced that the state government will challenge the decision in the Supreme Court.

title: India's 8 Core Industries Post 1.7% Growth In June
content: India's core industries comprising eight sectors reported 1.7 per cent growth in June 2025, down from 5 per cent in the same month of 2024, data released on Monday by Ministry of Commerce and Industry showed.

title: Delhi's Ayushman Arogya Mandir Rollout Picks Up Pace, 34 Centres To Be Inaugurated Soon
content: The Delhi government is ramping up its Ayushman Arogya Mandir initiative, with 34 new centres expected to be inaugurated by July 24 as part of the second phase.

title: Musk's X Calls French Foreign Interference Probe "Politically Motivated", Refuses To Cooperate
content: A French probe into alleged foreign interference and bias via the algorithm at Elon Musk-owned social network X is "politically motivated", the company said in a post Monday, adding that it was refusing to cooperate.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar's Resignation Starts Race For Next Vice President
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar's abrupt resignation on Monday evening has opened the contest for his successor.

title: Highway Blocked By Luxury Cars For Reels, Chhattisgarh High Court Slams Cops
content: In a sharp rebuke, the Chhattisgarh High Court has pulled up the Bilaspur Police for failing to confiscate luxury cars that were illegally parked on National Highway-130 during a late-night photoshoot organised by a group.

title: Video: Mercedes Stuck On Dumas Beach In Gujarat's Surat After Stunt Goes Wrong
content: It was a drive to survive for a Mercedes in Gujarat's Surat after a man drove the car into the sea. But, unlike a video game where there are cheat codes to drive in water, reality saw the high-end vehicle bogged down on Dumas Beach in Surat.

title: Aadhaar, voter ID & ration cards can‚Äôt be considered for SIR: EC
content: The Election Commission of India disagreed with the Supreme Court's view on using Aadhaar, voter ID, and ration cards for Bihar's electoral roll Special Summary Revision. EC stated these documents are unreliable. Aadhaar is just an identity proof. Many fake ration cards exist. Using current voter cards would defeat the purpose of the special drive.

title: India, Pak continue shadow boxing with Notams along borders for air exercises
content: Following recent cross-border hostilities, India and Pakistan continue strategic posturing by issuing Notams to reserve airspace for exercises. The IAF plans air combat drills near the border from July 23-25, while Pakistan has issued Notams for its central and southern regions, reflecting ongoing tensions after the May conflict triggered by India's strikes on terror hubs.

title: AAIB AI 171 crash probe totally unbiased: Naidu; final report awaited
content: Union Minister Ram Mohan Naidu addressed the Rajya Sabha about the Air India plane crash investigation. He stated that the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau follows a rule-based process. The AAIB is unbiased in its probe. Data from the plane's black boxes has been successfully decoded in India for the first time. The preliminary report is out.

title: Bihar 1st in country to get a cap of 1,200 voters per booth
content: Bihar is leading the way in electoral reform. The state has reduced the number of voters per polling station to 1,200. This change has increased the number of polling stations by 12,817. The Election Commission will implement this cap across India. The move aims to reduce long queues on polling day.

title: Tariff deadline Aug 1, US team to visit India in 2nd half of month
content: Despite Trump's August 1st deadline, US negotiators will visit India later in August, aiming for a bilateral trade agreement by Fall. Sticking points remain, particularly regarding American agricultural and dairy access, which India resists. India seeks gains in textiles, footwear, and auto parts. Trump's insistence on agricultural concessions and opaque deal-making with other nations are also concerns.

title: US Green Card delay: Public transit authority CEO resigns as work permit expires
content: The U.S. Green Card delays are impacting American corporations, forcing experienced executives to resign due to expiring work permits. Collie Greenwood, CEO of MARTA, stepped down after his permit expired, hindering key projects. Despite MARTA's confirmation of his 'imminent' Green Card delivery, Greenwood opted for early retirement.

title: ED summons Meta, Google on July 28 for ads on betting sites
content: Meta and Google, under ED investigation for hosting ads of illegal betting sites, have been granted an extension until July 28 to appear before the agency. They requested more time to gather documents related to the probe into betting sites that allegedly defrauded Indian citizens of crores.

title: I&B panel OKs 'Udaipur Files', but no SC nod yet
content: The I&B ministry's committee has approved the release of 'Udaipur Files: Kanhaiya Lal Tailor Murder' with modifications, including a revised disclaimer and name change. This decision follows objections from Maulana Arshad Madani and Mohd Javed, the main accused in the tailor's murder.

title: 15-yr-old alleges rape by hockey coaches in Odisha, 4 held
content: In Odisha's Jajpur district, police have detained four hockey coaches following allegations of gang rape by a 15-year-old trainee. The survivor's FIR states the assault occurred on July 3 after a coaching session, where the accused allegedly took her to a lodge.

title: Perplexity CEO to youngsters: Spend less time on Instagram, more time on‚Ä¶
content: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas advises young individuals to prioritize mastering AI tools over excessive social media use, emphasizing that AI proficiency will significantly enhance employability. He acknowledges the challenges of adapting to rapidly evolving AI technology, which changes every three to six months.

title: Tension and fury over Jaipur murder, key NH blocked
content: A 22-year-old Vipin Kumar was fatally stabbed near Jaipur. The alleged attacker Mohammad Anas and his aides are in custody. The incident triggered communal tension and protests. Anas, a history-sheeter, has several criminal cases against him. Police are investigating the motive behind the murder. Anas was shot in the leg during his arrest.

title: Something wrong on campus, says SC, puts lens on suicides
content: The Supreme Court is worried about rising student suicides. It asked IIT-Kharagpur and Sharda University for reports after two recent deaths. The court wants to know about FIR filings and university actions. It is reviewing a previous order to form a task force to prevent suicides. The task force is delayed due to logistical issues.

title: 20L formal job additions reported in May; surge spans gender, sectors & regions: EPFO
content: India's organised sector experienced unprecedented growth in May, adding over 20 lakh net payrolls, the highest since April 2018. This surge, which is driven by youth and women, reflects the formalisation of the workforce across various sectors and regions. Maharashtra led regional contributions, signalling enhanced job confidence and workforce fluidity, highlighting the need for sustained skill development and social protection.

title: 'Living in denial': Elon Musk admits; says ‚ÄòNow it is game on‚Äô
content: Elon Musk, acknowledging his past resistance to AI, has declared ‚Äúgame on,‚Äù signaling a more aggressive approach to the technology. This shift follows his earlier warnings about AI's potential dangers. Musk's renewed focus is evident through xAI, his startup competing with industry giants.

title: Ex-Nalco chief, wife convicted in graft case
content: An ED special court convicted Abhay Srivastava, former Nalco CMD, his wife, and two associates for money laundering. They were found guilty of receiving bribes from contractors in exchange for a coal supply tender. The investigation revealed illicit funds were used to purchase and conceal gold bars, stored in a bank locker operated by Srivastava's wife.

title: Odisha NSUI chief arrested after 19-year-old alleges rape
content: In a significant setback for Congress, Udit Narayan Pradhan, the Odisha NSUI president, was arrested for allegedly raping a 19-year-old student in Bhubaneswar. The survivor filed a police complaint alleging that Pradhan drugged and sexually assaulted her in a hotel in March, prompting his immediate suspension by NSUI. The arrest follows increased scrutiny of crimes against women in Odisha.

title: Travis Hunter‚Äôs wife Leanna Lenee‚Äôs tearful video
content: A video of Leanna Lenee, Travis Hunter's wife, crying sparked divorce rumors among fans, fueled by past criticism of their relationship. Leanna Lenee clarified that the video is old and she has since grown spiritually, distancing herself from social media. Travis Hunter has not commented and is concentrating on his NFL preparations.

title: Paulina Gretzky‚Äôs Hollywood dreams, huge net worth show her own star
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of NHL legend Wayne Gretzky, has carved her own path with a $5 million net worth. Initially aiming for ballet, she transitioned to modeling and acting, appearing in movies like 'Fame' and 'Grown Ups 2'. She also explored singing, releasing her song 'Collecting Dust', and is now a social media influencer.

title: Dwyane Wade shows peaceful retreat after Kaavia‚Äôs ‚Äòcountry girl‚Äô moment
content: Dwyane Wade shares glimpses of his family moments. He posts videos of daughter Kaavia with a pony. Gabrielle Union is also seen in the video. Wade also shares a serene sea view from his vacation home. He emphasizes the importance of freedom for Kaavia. Wade and Union foster compassion and individuality in their parenting.

title: Travis Kelce goes solo in LA as Taylor Swift faces family emergency
content: Pop singer Taylor Swift is helping her father, Scott Swift, recover after heart surgery. Her partner, Travis Kelce, was seen driving in Los Angeles. Kelce is supporting Swift and her family during this time. He is also preparing for Kansas City Chiefs training camp. Kelce and his brother are pausing their podcast.

title: 103 cities show drop in PM10 levels under clean air programme; Mumbai leads among metros
content: Good news arrives from the Environment Ministry. Air quality improves across India. A majority of cities under the National Clean Air Programme show lower pollution levels in 2024-25 compared to 2017-18. Mumbai sees the biggest drop among metros. Chennai is the only big city meeting air quality standards.

title: ED summons 4 top south actors in online betting case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned actors Vijay Deverakonda, Rana Daggubati, Prakash Raj, and Manchu Lakshmi as part of an investigation into the promotion of illegal online betting platforms.

title: 'ED erred': Probe agencies can't summon lawyers, says AG
content: The Enforcement Directorate made a mistake. It summoned lawyers Arvind Datar and Pratap Venugopal. They were summoned for giving legal advice. The Attorney General R Venkataramani informed the Supreme Court about this. All probe agencies received instructions. They must not repeat this error. The court emphasized lawyer-client privilege. Guidelines will be framed soon.

title: Forces hunt for terrorists in Kishtwar‚Äôs forests
content: A joint team of the Army and J&K Police continued a cordon-and-search operation in Kishtwar district. They extensively combed the dense forests to hunt terrorists. The operation, which started on Sunday, paused overnight and resumed on Monday. Additional troops, helicopters, and sniffer dogs aided the search.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up about facing ‚Äúpublic humiliation‚Äù after choosing surrogacy
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union faced significant challenges in starting a family. Union recently shared her emotional struggles with Marie Claire, revealing that miscarriages and the subsequent surrogacy journey took a toll on her mental health. She described the experience as feeling like a "f---ing public humiliation" when it didn't go as planned.

title: ISKCON reports influencer eating KFC inside Soho restaurant to police
content: A black male YouTuber sparked outrage after eating KFC inside Govinda's vegan restaurant in Soho, violating its sacred space. ISKCON leaders condemned the act, attributing it to a lack of spiritual education and societal degradation. Police are investigating the incident, which has offended Hindus globally and raised concerns about online behavior.

title: Speak up in Parliament for ‚Äòmarginalised‚Äô Muslims, Mehbooba urges Rahul
content: Mehbooba Mufti has urged Rahul Gandhi to address the increasing marginalization of Muslims in India during the Parliament's monsoon session. She highlighted concerns over the targeting of Muslims under the pretext of identifying illegal immigrants and the alleged disenfranchisement efforts through electoral roll revisions in Bihar.

title: NHL: Connor McDavid might re-sign with Oilers but other teams are also in the mix
content: NHL insider Chris Johnston sparks speculation about Connor McDavid's future with the Edmonton Oilers as his contract nears its end in 2026. While Johnston suggests re-signing with Edmonton is likely, he acknowledges the allure of other teams and McDavid's Stanley Cup aspirations. The Oilers' recent Finals loss to the Panthers fuels doubts, leaving fans anxious about their captain's decision.

title: Only lawyers can wear white shirt, black coat inside court: J&K bar association
content: The Jammu high court bar association has prohibited non-lawyers from wearing the lawyer's uniform of white shirt, black trousers, and black coat on court premises. This decision aims to curb unauthorized individuals posing as advocates and misleading litigants, addressing concerns raised by young lawyers.

title: Twin landslides kill Vaishno Devi devotee, Poonch school kid
content: A series of unfortunate landslides struck Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in the loss of two lives. A pilgrim died near the Vaishno Devi shrine in Katra, prompting a temporary suspension of the yatra. In a separate incident, a young student was killed when a boulder struck a government school in Poonch, highlighting the vulnerability of the region to natural disasters.

title: Dhankhar resigns as VP: What happens next? All you need to know about election process
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned as vice president, citing health concerns and following medical advice, a position he held since 2022. His resignation triggers a constitutional process for the Election Commission to promptly organize an election to fill the vacancy. The vice president also serves as the ex-officio chairman of the Rajya Sabha.

title: Toni Kukoc just explained why Giannis Antetokounmpo might be even scarier
content: Toni Kukoc, the former Chicago Bulls champion, draws parallels between his versatile playing style and Giannis Antetokounmpo's dominance. While acknowledging Giannis's physical gifts, Kukoc points out the 'Greek Freak' lacks a reliable jump shot. Kukoc speculates that if Giannis develops a consistent shot, he could become an even more unstoppable force in the NBA.

title: '... goes & tells PM Modi': Congress leaders step up attack on Shashi Tharoor
content: The Congress party stepped up attack on Shashi Tharoor as the Parliament's monsoon session begins. Senior Kerala leaders urged Tharoor to resign on his own due to his pro-Modi stance on key policy issues.

title: Where is Rohit Sharma? Latest social media post clears the air - See pics
content: Rohit Sharma, the former Test captain, shared heartwarming family moments, posting photos on Instagram that quickly went viral. The veteran opener, who retired from Test cricket in May, appeared relaxed while spending quality time with his wife and children. The 38-year-old recently made headlines when former India selector Jatin Paranjape revealed that Sharma had been managing a hamstring injury throughout the ICC Champions Trophy

title: India‚Äôs playing XI for 4thTest: Stick to specialists or ... ‚Äì the dilemma returns!
content: Massive selection headache for Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill ahead of the Manchester Test. In a do-or-die match, with weather set to play a key role, it would be interesting to see whether India will go for a specialist bowler or stick with their safety-first approach.

title: Fake Pakistan clip shared to incite riots; 3 arrested in UP; ISI link being probed
content: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested three men for circulating a fake video, falsely claiming the killing of Muslims and aiming to incite communal tensions during Kanwar Yatra. The accused, Nadeem, Mansher, and Rahees, confessed their motive. Police suspect possible involvement of Pakistan-based ISI handlers. The video, originating from Pakistan, was shared on WhatsApp groups with false audio claiming Bajrang Dal involvement.

title: This tech company is set to cross $4.5 trillion market cap
content: Nvidia's market dominance in AI chips faces challenges from competitors and clients developing custom silicon. While Nvidia's valuation soared, Microsoft, fueled by Azure's growth and OpenAI investment, is poised to reach a $4.5 trillion market cap. Analysts suggest Microsoft presents a more favorable investment opportunity due to its growth potential and strategic positioning in cloud computing and enterprise software.

title: IND vs ENG: Playing XI announced! England make one change for Manchester Test
content: England welcome Liam Dawson back into the Test side, replacing injured Shoaib Bashir for the crucial Fourth Test against India. Meanwhile, young pacer Anshul Kamboj could debut for India amid injury concerns in their pace attack. Rishabh Pant's return to wicketkeeping duties provides a significant boost as India aim to bounce back in the series.

title: Indore-bound IndiGo flight makes emergency landing; suffers technical snag
content: An IndiGo flight 6E 813, en route from Goa to Indore, experienced a technical issue just before landing on Monday. According to an IndiGo spokesperson, the aircraft landed safely in Indore and will undergo thorough checks as per protocol before resuming operations.

title: Chess | India sensation Divya in emotional turmoil after World Cup QF win - Watch
content: Young Indian chess player Divya Deshmukh triumphed over compatriot Harika Dronavalli in a thrilling tie-break, securing a spot in the FIDE Women‚Äôs World Cup semifinals on Monday. Her victory sets up a clash with former world champion Tan Zhongyi of China. Grandmaster Koneru Humpy also advanced, guaranteeing India two players in the semifinals and a historic moment for Indian chess.

title: Parliament ruckus: PM Modi holds key meet; Shah, Nadda attend - what was discussed
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi convened a significant high-level meeting in Parliament on Monday, with key BJP leaders in attendance. The discussions likely centered on strategizing and making crucial decisions concerning the ongoing Monsoon session, which commenced on the same day and is scheduled to continue until August 21. Modi hailed the session as a 'Vijay Utsav,' celebrating the armed forces' capabilities.

title: Bangladesh air force jet crashes into school: At least 20 dead, over 150 injured
content: A Bangladesh air force training aircraft, identified as an F-7 BGI, crashed into Milestone School and College in Dhaka's Uttara area during a routine training mission. The crash, which occurred around 1:06 pm while classes were in session, resulted in at least one fatality and several injuries.
